answer_html: \(= \begin{bmatrix} 0&1\\1&0 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} \sigma_1&0 &0 \\0 & \sigma_2 & 0 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} \frac{1}{\sqrt(2)} & 0 & -\frac{1}{\sqrt(2)} \\ \frac{1}{\sqrt(2)} & 0 & \frac{1}{\sqrt(2)} \\ 0 & 1 & 0 \end{bmatrix}\)It can be seen that the third column of V is an orthogonal basis for N(A), and both columns of U form the basis for R(A).
question: Section 201 07 (b)
sols_html:
The equation for the singular value matrix decomposition is

\(A\) = \(U \Sigma V^*\) = \(U \Sigma V^T\)

\(= \begin{bmatrix} 0&1\\1&0 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} \sigma_1&0 &0 \\0 & \sigma_2 & 0 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} \frac{1}{\sqrt(2)} & 0 & -\frac{1}{\sqrt(2)} \\ \frac{1}{\sqrt(2)} & 0 & \frac{1}{\sqrt(2)} \\ 0 & 1 & 0 \end{bmatrix}\)

It can be seen that the third column of V is an orthogonal basis for N(A), and both columns of U form the basis for R(A).
statement_html:
Suppose that the matrix A has the following singular value decomposition:

\[\begin{aligned} A = \begin{bmatrix} 0 & 1 \\ 1 & 0 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} \sigma_1 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & \sigma_2 & 0 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} 1/\sqrt 2 & 1/\sqrt 2 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 1 \\ -1\sqrt 2 & 1/\sqrt 2 & 0 \end{bmatrix}\end{aligned}\]

where \(\sigma_1 \geq \sigma_2 \geq 0\).

(b) Write down an orthonormal basis for N(A) and an orthonormal basis for R(A).
